description: Type/schema: designer layout model contains only CSS-like properties (no constraint solver fields).
Unit: mapping from layout props to DOM styles produces expected inline styles/classes for containers and items.
Integration: flex column container lays out children vertically with expected spacing.
Integration: flex row container lays out children horizontally with expected spacing.
Integration: gap/padding/border settings change DOM box model as expected in the canvas.
Integration: justify-content/align-items settings impact child positioning as expected.
Integration: width/height/min/max settings apply as CSS constraints without runtime geometry math.
Integration: flex grow/shrink/basis settings affect layout as expected for sibling items.
Integration: grid container renders children using CSS grid template columns/rows and gap.
Unit: collision detection uses pointerWithin-first with closestCenter fallback and yields consistent 'over' targets for simple container setups.
E2E: drag to reorder within the same container updates node order deterministically.
E2E: drag a node from container A to container B inserts at expected index.
E2E: nesting a node into an eligible container succeeds; nesting into an ineligible container is rejected.
E2E: drop indicator shows before/after insertion cues based on cursor position.
E2E: invalid drop shows blocked indicator and does not mutate designer state.
Integration: image nodes with aspect ratio render with correct box ratio via CSS aspect-ratio.
E2E: resizing an image node updates pixel sizing props and DOM layout changes accordingly.
E2E: resizing a section/stack container updates pixel sizing props and DOM layout changes accordingly.
Integration: property-panel can set width/height as CSS strings (%, rem, auto) and the canvas reflects the change.
Unit: drag-resize always writes pixel values (px) even when the property panel was last set to non-px sizing.
E2E: edge snapping chooses before/after insertion index consistently near sibling boundaries in flex containers.
E2E: grid snapping aligns drop indicator/insertion to deterministic cell/index when parent is grid.
Unit: drag-drop state updates persist only container + insertion index; no coordinate fields are written.
Repo: no imports/references remain to deleted geometry utilities after removal.
Unit: utils/layout.ts contains no coordinate math helpers (assert via snapshot/grep-based test).
Integration: exporting workspace snapshot includes layout props and re-import preserves them.
Integration: preview output matches renderer semantics for layout-related properties (spacing/alignment/aspect ratio).
